item.title: Concern over SA's algal bloom pushing visitors to other SA tourist towns
item.description: An algal bloom that has been ravaging parts of SA's coast for months is pushing visitors to head to other parts of the state.

item.title: Mother of 13yo who fell pregnant in state care says system 'ruining lives'
item.description: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

item.title: As Victoria's grassland dries with warmer weather, the CFA warns of increased fire risk
item.description: Grassland in Victoria has dried significantly since September, including in the north-west of the state and in outer Melbourne, putting firefighters on edge.

item.title: Yarloop locals mark decade since bushfire destroyed 160 homes and killed two people
item.description: Ten years after a bushfire took just seven minutes to tear through Yarloop, residents say community spirit and support from neighbouring towns helped get them through the tragedy.

item.title: Council criticised for removing 'illegally planted' trees from sensitive sand dunes
item.description: A Queensland council is being criticised for uprooting unauthorised saplings from sand dunes amid a long-running vegetation battle.

item.title: Novak Djokovic withdraws from Australian Open lead-up event at Adelaide International
item.description: With the Australian Open on the horizon, Novak Djokovic does not feel he is well enough prepared to contest next week's Adelaide International.

item.title: Site selection delayed for desalination plant Lower Great Southern needs 'to survive'
item.description: Plans for a desalination plant in Western Australia's Great Southern are delayed as the clock ticks to secure a critical water source.

item.title: Top Trump adviser refuses to rule out military action to take over Greenland
item.description: Stephen Miller, Mr Trump's chief of staff for policy, said the Trump administration believed Greenland should become an American territory in order for the US to "protect and defend NATO".

item.title: Dragons sign Keaon Koloamatangi from Rabbitohs on massive five-year NRL deal
item.description: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

item.title: Woman who lost home in Koolewong bushfire reunited with cat seriously injured in blaze
item.description: Sassy the cat was almost killed when a bushfire razed a Koolewong home on NSW's Central Coast. Now, the lucky pet has been reunited with her family.

item.title: US cuts number of vaccines recommended for children including flu, hepatitis A and B
item.description: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

item.title: Former Queensland senator Ron 'Bozzie' Boswell dies aged 85
item.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

item.title: BlueScope Steel weighing up $13 billion takeover by Kerry Stokes's SGH and US partner
item.description: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

item.title: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house
item.description: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

item.title: Venezuela left as 'potential powder keg' after Maduro capture, experts say
item.description: The US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has left the country with an uncertain future, sparked concern among regional neighbours and could embolden other countries in territorial disputes, some experts say.

item.title: Madison Keys, Aryna Sabalenka kick off Australian summer of tennis with wins at Brisbane International
item.description: Defending Australian Open champion Madison Keys and last year's runner up Aryna Sabalenka both got their Australian summer off to winning starts with straight-sets victories at the Brisbane International.

item.title: Anthony Albanese doesn't rule out calling royal commission into Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese does not rule out calling a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, but says his immediate priority is the review of intelligence and security agencies.

item.title: Here's how sinkholes can form underground long before anyone realises
item.description: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

item.title: Public library visitor numbers return to pre-COVID levels as cost-of-living crisis bites
item.description: Public libraries in Australia are experimenting with inventive ways to attract new members — but a lack of funding means they must do more with less.

item.title: WA Police raid Bunbury tobacconist after suspected firebomb of different vape store
item.description: Police seize vapes and cigarettes from the South West WA store days after two different shops were destroyed.

item.title: Some NSW farmers say 10 guns are not enough ahead of planned restrictions
item.description: New gun laws in NSW will limit farmers to 10 guns but the industry says this is not enough, and the change could see "a whole lot more firearms and ammunition" moving between farms in vehicles.

item.title: Bondi terror attack royal commission pressure trumps Albanese's beliefs
item.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

item.title: Steve Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory
item.description: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Jenna the second system to lash Cocos Keeling Islands in less than two weeks
item.description: Residents of the islands clean up following heavy rain and winds brought by Tropical Cyclone Jenna, less than two weeks another system battered the region on Christmas day.

item.title: Human remains found in search for snorkeller missing off WA's Ledge Point
item.description: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.

item.description: The US has justified the seizure of deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores by arguing they had breached US domestic law. So what exactly have they been accused of doing?

item.description: Twin wins from Alex de Minaur drags Australia off the canvas and into the United Cup quarterfinals with a do-or-die victory over Czechia.

item.description: A draft statement outlines what Ukraine's allies could commit to if Russia attacks its neighbour again in the future.

item.description: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American takeover of the Danish territory, saying the island is needed for national security.

item.title: Trump's intervention in Venezuela heralds an incomparable era
item.description: The global shock caused by the Trump administration's interventions in Venezuela sent analysts scurrying for historic comparisons, but nothing really compares to what happened at the weekend.

item.description: Firefighters in Victoria continue to battle a bushfire in the state's north-east as a heatwave brings temperatures near 45 degrees Celsius to some parts of the country.

item.description: Venezuelans celebrate what once felt impossible — but inside the country, armed powerbrokers, nervous officials and rival factions are already jostling over what comes next.

item.description: Southern Australia will collectively bake this week through the most intense spell of heat in years as temperatures soar up to 15 degrees Celsius above the mid-summer average.

item.description: The lack of knowledge about the species has experts worried echidnas could decline without anyone noticing.

item.description: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

item.description: Commuters in Canberra are facing major disruptions as Commonwealth Avenue Bridge undergoes two years of major upgrades.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued a severe weather warning for the north Queensland coast as a tropical low approaches.

item.description: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

item.title: Kids at tiny school work to save extremely rare 'flying jewel' purple copper butterfly
item.description: It's the size of a 10-cent piece and matures under the guard of protective ants, but the purple copper butterfly needs more help to survive — and a group of NSW primary school students has stepped up to the challenge.

item.title: The tough balance of circumstance and support systems as WA woman faces eviction
item.description: As protesters strive to keep a woman from community housing eviction, the complexities of her situation collide with a housing provider's options.

item.title: Travellers urged not to rely solely on navigation systems for directions following recent strandings
item.description: A young couple got bogged on a remote dirt road in north Queensland and was forced to walk hours in search of help after trusting their navigation app to find a 24-hour fuel station.

item.description: Southern Australia is enduring its most intense heatwave in years, with temperatures set to soar from today until the weekend.

item.description: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

item.title: Inflation cools in November with consumer prices rising 3.4pc but still above the RBA's target
item.description: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier. Some economists continue to forecast a February rate hike, however.

item.description: A peak-hour crash on Hobart's Southern Outlet leads to 17 people being assessed at the Royal Hobart Hospital.

item.description: Former High Court judge Virginia Bell will lead the inquiry into antisemitism. But who is the new commissioner?

item.title: Ashes player ratings: England and Australia report card from 2025-26 Test series
item.description: Here are the player ratings from a one-sided Ashes series with a few stand-outs and perhaps more flame-outs across the five Tests.

item.title: New research finds keeping room temperature at 24 degrees or below could reduce sleep stress for older Australians
item.description: The study by Griffith University in Brisbane finds that a room temperature while sleeping of more than 24 degrees Celsius increases heart rate variability and physiological stress.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: What is a pyroCB, a fire-generated thunderstorm?
item.description: The fire burning in north-east Victoria near Walwa was so fierce it generated its own weather this afternoon, including a substantial pyrocumulonimbus cloud with lightning and thunder.

item.title: Men face court charged with manslaughter of 66-year-old who died after Hobart CBD altercation
item.description: Two men face court after a 66-year-old man died from injuries police allege were sustained in an assault at a popular Hobart shopping strip.

item.title: Victorian properties feared lost in out-of-control bushfire as heatwave persists
item.description: Multiple properties are feared lost to an out-of-control bushfire in central Victoria, as Australia's first heatwave of the year continued to bring high temperatures across the country.

item.title: Police arrest suspects after armed heist at airport believed to be Vanuatu's first organised robbery
item.description: A brazen heist at Port Vila International Airport has stunned Vanuatu and become the talk of a nation unused to such overtly public acts of crime.

item.title: Albanese defends leadership after royal commission backflip
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump says US oversight of Venezuela could last for years
item.description: Donald Trump has said that "only time will tell" how long the United States will maintain oversight of Venezuela.

item.title: England vice-captain Harry Brook apologises for incident at New Zealand nightclub ahead of Ashes
item.description: Harry Brook was fined $60,000 and has apologised for bringing "embarrassment" to the English cricket team in a scuffle with a bouncer shortly before the Ashes.

item.title: Rinky Hijikata suffers three-set loss against Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard at Brisbane International
item.description: Rinky Hijikata's three-set loss to big-serving Frenchman Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard means there are no Australians left in the Brisbane International singles.

item.title: On her 44th birthday, Princess Catherine is quietly reshaping royal life after cancer
item.description: Catherine turns 44 today as she resets royal life with fewer public appearances, tighter boundaries and a strong emphasis on family life — a choice shaped by loss, illness and the pressure of being next in line.

item.title: Three people missing in Longwood bushfire amid 'catastrophic' fire danger for Victoria
item.description: Three people, including a child, are missing after a house was destroyed by the out-of-control Longwood bushfire in central Victoria, according to police.

item.title: Victorians on edge as state experiences first catastrophic bushfire conditions since 2019
item.description: Catastrophic fire danger warnings are in place across parts of Victoria's north and west today, with two significant fires already burning out of control and soaring temperatures forecast on Friday.

item.title: Heatwave and fire threat forecast for NSW, Victoria and SA as temperatures nudge all-time record highs
item.description: Southern states continue to sweat through one of the most intense heatwaves on record, and for many regions, including Melbourne and Sydney, the hottest weather is still to come.

item.title: Today in History, January 9: Hungry Adelaide protesters demand beef in violent riot
item.description: During the Great Depression, Adelaide residents were getting hungrier and more desperate by the day. Then the state government made a wildly unpopular decision.

item.title: JD Vance defends Minnesota shooting as self-defence amid immigration crackdown
item.description: US Vice-President JD Vance says the shooting was justified and that 37-year-old mother-of-three Renee Nicole Good was a "victim of left-wing ideology".

item.title: Antisemitism royal commission welcome, but some say it was called too late
item.description: Community groups that lobbied for a national inquiry into antisemitism back the prime minister's announcement of a royal commission as the NSW premier pledges the NSW government's full cooperation.

item.title: Donald Trump's comments about Greenland were once seen as a joke. Greenlanders are no longer laughing
item.description: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

item.title: What landlords are obliged to do to cool your rental as temperatures rise
item.description: With the nation gripped by a heatwave, renters will be looking at their rights for cooling their homes. Here's what they can do.

item.title: How the internet reacted to the fifth Ashes Test at the SCG
item.description: The internet went wild as Australia dominated with the bat, led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, and England crumbled in the dying embers of the Ashes.

item.title: Solar to the fore as grid sails through heatwave and record demand
item.description: For so long, the pounding sunshine of an Australian heatwave was the grid's biggest threat. It has now become its greatest asset.

item.title: US Senate votes to limit Trump's power to order strikes in Venezuela
item.description: The vote in the Republican-controlled chamber still needs to pass the US House, and has virtually no chance of becoming law due to Donald Trump's presidential veto.

item.title: Australian heatwave live: Firefighters battling multiple out-of-control blazes across Victoria
item.description: Victorian and South Australian authorities are battling "catastrophic" and "extreme" fire conditions as Australia continues to swelter through a heatwave. Follow live.

item.title: Insect enthusiasts helping researchers keep an eye on bug populations
item.description: Queensland insect enthusiasts are snapping photos of their backyard bugs to help researchers monitor native and invasive species.

item.title: Kings Forest Estate finally for sale after land-banking saga spanning five decades
item.description: More than 30 years after the land was rezoned to allow residential development, blocks in the Kings Forest Estate are finally on the market.

item.title: Locals, summer tourists swelter through heatwave in South Australia's Riverland
item.description: South Australia's Riverland will swelter through yet another day in the mid-to-high 40s on Friday and will have to wait until the weekend for a reprieve.

item.title: 'High chance' of a tropical cyclone forming off Queensland's north-east coast bringing heavy rainfall
item.description: A tropical low off the Coral Coast could have the potential to become a tropical cyclone over the weekend, as residents across the far-north prepare for heavy rainfall.

item.title: Maya Joint gets Ash Barty's backing with teenager's Australian Open milestone confirmed
item.description: Teenage star Maya Joint will be the first home women's seed at the Australian Open since former world number one Ash Barty broke a 44-year title drought in 2022.

item.title: RBA plays the long game on inflation, so an interest rate rise could still be some way off
item.description: The Reserve Bank says inflation is "too high", but that doesn't mean it will necessarily rush to raise interest rates next month.

item.title: Venezuelan and foreign prisoners to be released following seizure of Nicolás Maduro
item.description: The president of the country's parliament says that Venezuelan and foreign prisoners will be released in the coming hours.

item.title: Matildas and Arsenal star Kyra Cooney-Cross returns home in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis
item.description: Arsenal's Australia international Kyra Cooney-Cross flies back to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.

item.title: Dubbo woman Molly Croft raises $2 million after battling cancer twice
item.description: This 19-year-old from western NSW, who has been diagnosed with cancer twice, is now helping others "find their rainbow".

item.title: NT pokies clubs report member perks, lavish upgrades as 'community' benefits
item.description: Previously secret documents released under Freedom of Information laws have revealed how the Northern Territory's pokies clubs' community contributions are really being spent.

item.title: Rio Tinto stock tumbles on Glencore merger talks, dragging down ASX — as it happened
item.description: Glencore has confirmed media speculation that the company is back in merger talks with Rio Tinto. Follow updates live on our business and finance blog.

item.title: Top tips for learning a musical instrument or taking up singing at any age
item.description: You can pick up an instrument or learn to sing at any age. Here are some helpful tips from experts and ABC Classic audience members to get you started.

item.title: Community rushes to help victims of Appin crash that left 17-year-old dead
item.description: The 17-year-old was killed and other passengers were seriously injured when a ute and sedan collided on a notorious road in Appin.

item.title: Assault-accused MP Nick McBride says home detention makes him 'more wedded' to electorate
item.description: South Australian MP Nick McBride, who has been charged with aggravated assault, says home detention will make him "more focused" on his electorate ahead of the SA election in March.

item.title: Inside Nicolás Maduro's complex network of alleged drug traffickers wanted by the US
item.description: The deposed Venezuelan president allegedly oversaw a network of associates to facilitate the flow of illegal drugs into the US, aided by false passports, a guerilla training school, jets and grenade launchers.

item.title: Airport lost luggage auctions raise thousands of dollars for charity every year
item.description: From tablets, headphones and laptops to prams, vacuum cleaners and even a prosthetic leg — these are the items being left behind each year at major airports.

item.title: Man in anaphylactic shock on Virgin flight to WA's Pilbara saved by crew, another passenger
item.description: Pilbara resident Andrew Rawle found himself 30,000 feet in the air, unable to breathe due to anaphylactic shock, but was saved by the crew and the selfless act of another passenger.

item.title: Total fire ban to begin in the ACT for the first time in six years
item.description: For the first time since the Black Summer bushfires, a total fire ban will be imposed in the ACT. The ban will be in place for the duration of Saturday.

item.title: Angela Jones's history-making ride from country upbringing to top of Queensland's jockey ranks
item.description: Angela Jones became the number one jockey in Queensland in 2025. Now, the determined young woman, who grew up on a central Queensland cattle farm, wants Group 1 glory.

item.title: How The Pitt lured ER star Noah Wyle back into the emergency department
item.description: ER launched Noah Wyle's career in 1994. Thirty years later he's back in the emergency room — and scooping awards season — as Dr Robby in The Pitt.

item.title: US border agent shoots and wounds two people in Portland, police say
item.description: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop in Portland when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

item.title: NetBlocks reports internet blackout imposed in Iran amid nationwide protests
item.description: Human rights groups say more than 40 people have been killed in protest-related violence since last month.

item.title: Arsenal's Gabriel Martinelli apologises for 'disgraceful' act towards injured Liverpool player Conor Bradley
item.description: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for shoving Liverpool's Conor Bradley, who was down with a serious knee injury, off the pitch during their Premier League clash.

item.title: Rio Tinto in merger talks with Glencore, takeover could create world's biggest miner
item.description: Rio Tinto and Glencore are in takeover talks that could potentially lead to a combined mega miner worth more than $US200 billion. Analysts are questioning whether Rio will be interested in Glencore's coal assets, having sold off its own in 2018.

item.title: Track temperatures live as southern states bake in heatwave
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves through the southern states.

item.title: Diana Camacaro fled Venezuela when a friend close to Nicolás Maduro's regime texted her she was on a list to be arrested
item.description: When a Telegram message landed on her phone, Diana knew she had to flee Venezuela. It was from someone close to Nicolás Maduro, and she says she would have been jailed, or worse.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios not seeking Australian Open wildcard, saying he is 'not quite ready' for grand slam
item.description: Returning from injury, Nick Kyrgios has spoken with Australian Open organisers and made the call not to use a wildcard to play singles this year.

item.title: What we know about Australian Teagan Croft who will play Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled
item.description: Australian actress Teagan Croft will take on the lead role of Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. The 21-year-old will star alongside Milo Manheim in the live-action remake.

item.title: The Bondi royal commission will be a long-term test of Albanese's leadership
item.description: The prime minister's critics feel he failed to meet the moment in the immediate aftermath of the Bondi attack, but with the royal commission he has a chance to get it right.

item.title: Australia's population forecast to reach 28 million in 2026 despite fall in overseas migrants
item.description: Australia's population is forecast to reach 28 million people in 2026 despite an easing of overseas arrivals following the post-COVID-19 migration peak.

item.title: Total fire ban as extreme fire weather predicted for parts of eastern Tasmania this weekend
item.description: A total fire ban is in place for parts of Tasmania from Saturday, due to extreme fire weather predicted for the weekend.

item.title: Donald Trump pulls US out of dozens of international organisations on environment and security
item.description: Protecting women and children, halting climate change and preventing acts of terrorism — these are the goals the White House now says go against America's goals.

item.title: Police vision shows a person being rescued from a submerged car during severe flooding in Queensland.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police urge drivers not to enter Queensland floodwaters and risk life
item.description: Authorities hope fines will deter motorists from driving into flooded waters, after nearly half-a-dozen vehicles are stranded in two weeks.

item.title: Palestinian author seeks to be reinstated to Adelaide Writers' Week
item.description: Palestinian author Randa Abdel-Fattah has called for her appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week to be reinstated after it was axed, but SA's Premier has continued to back the decision, as dozens of authors cancel their appearances.

item.title: Grass fire burning in Wagga Wagga's north
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Surge in heat-related illness as temperatures continue to soar across south-east
item.description: Emergency departments, medical centres and first responders are dealing with a surge in heat-related illness across Australia's south-east as temperatures soar to near record levels.

item.title: Helicopter vision shows scale of the Longwood fire.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Zone RV director accused of insolvent trading as early as 2023
item.description: Administrators of the collapsed luxury caravan manufacturer have threatened to sue David Biggar, whose company owes customers millions of dollars.

item.title: Senior SA government officials reject claims of political interference into algal bloom causes
item.description: Four of the most senior public servants working on South Australia's algal bloom have rejected allegations that departmental staff had been instructed not to investigate the cause of the ecological disaster until after March's state election.

item.title: Violence against state school teachers and staff nearly quadruples in three years, new data shows
item.description: The data, tabled in Queensland Parliament, showed there were 20,833 occupational violence and aggression incidents reported by school-based employees last year.
